doc.after: This species is only found in West Africa from Guinea to Ghana.[2] It is locally common in southeastern Guinea, and is widespread in Sierra Leone except for the north and northwest, and in Liberia except for the north and northeast.[2] In CÃ´te d'Ivoire the species is currently restricted to areas near the Guinean and Liberian border.[2] The bird also lives in Ghana, where it is both local and uncommon in the south central parts of the nation.[13] The white-necked rockfowl's total range covers approximately 391,000Â km2 (151,000Â sqÂ mi).[19] However, the species occurs in low population densities in patches across this large range.[20] The species does not migrate, though it does disperse widely after the breeding season.[21]
